paper_abstract: Minihypers were introduced by Hamada to investigate linear codes meeting the Griesmer bound. Hamada (Bull Osaka Women's Univ 24: 1-47, 1985; Discrete Math 116: 229-268, 1993) characterized the non-weighted minihypers having parameters {Sigma(h)(i)= 1 upsilon lambda(i)+ 1, Sigma(h)(i)= 1 upsilon lambda(i); k - 1, q}, with k - 1 > lambda(1) > lambda(2) > ... > lambda(h) >= 0, as the union of lambda(1)-dimensional space,lambda(2)-dimensional space,...,lambda(h)-dimensional space, which all are pairwise disjoint. We present in this article a weighted version of this result. We prove that a weighted {Sigma(h)(i)= 1 upsilon lambda(i)+ 1, Sigma(h)(i)= 1 upsilon lambda(i); k - 1, q}- minihyper F, with k - 1 > lambda 1 > lambda(2) > ... > lambda(h) = 0, is a sum of lambda(1)-dimensional space,lambda(2)-dimensional space,..., and lambda(h)-dimensional space.
paper_title: A weighted version of a result of Hamada on minihypers and on linear codes meeting the Griesmer bound
